author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Punjab National Bank (PNB) branch manager was arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation on Thursday for allegedly demanding 3 per cent commission on loans granted under the Pradhan Mantri Rozgar Srijan Yojana.

The accused had received Rs.10,000 from an applicant.

The scheme is meant to provide self-employment to the educated unemployed youth through investments in service, industry and business sectors.

The accused is a manager in a Kaithal branch of PNB in Haryana.

The CBI received a complaint from a person alleging that the manager had demanded Rs.10,000 as first instalment for clearing a loan of Rs. 5.7 lakh under the Central government scheme.

Prepared proposal

The complainant first went to the bank and enquired about the procedures to be followed to get loan under the scheme.

He then prepared his proposal and applied for a loan of Rs. 5.7 lakh.

However, the branch official did not accept his application and instead, asked him to pay 3 per cent of the total loan amount.

Based on the complaint, the CBI initiated a probe into the allegations and mounted surveillance on the accused manager. Following negotiations, the manager allegedly scaled down the commission to Rs.10,000 as first instalment.

Trap laid

Accordingly, the CBI sleuths laid a trap and arrested the manager when he was receiving the amount from the complainant, according to sources. “Searches are being conducted on the official and residential premises of the accused,” said a CBI official.
title: CBI arrests PNB branch manager on graft charge
